intro: Renealmia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty renealmia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family, commonly known as the arrowroot family. The plant is characterized by its striking, often variegated foliage with a reddish or rusty hue on the underside of the leaves. It typically grows as a rhizomatous herb, forming dense clumps with broad, strap-shaped leaves. Renealmia ferruginea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded garden settings.
